metadata.title: CVE-2019-15213 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.2.3. There is ause-after-free caused by a malicious USB device in thedrivers/media/usb/dvb-usb/dvb-usb-init.c driver.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1001-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-28').
